_metadata.description: Verified provider disputes using AI research

verifications.reasoning: Logan City Light & Power is the official name of the municipal utility serving Logan, UT. 'City of Logan' is a general reference to the municipal services provided by the city, which includes Logan City Light & Power.
verifications.split_details: The entire ZIP code 84321 is served by Logan City Light & Power as it is a municipal utility for the city of Logan and surrounding areas.

verifications.reasoning: Enbridge Gas primarily operates in Canada, while Dominion Energy is a known provider in Utah. Official utility service maps and local government resources confirm Dominion Energy serves the Logan, UT area.
verifications.split_details: Dominion Energy is the sole provider for the specified ZIP code area.

verifications.correct_provider: Lehi City Power and Rocky Mountain Power
verifications.reasoning: Lehi City Power is a municipal utility serving the city of Lehi, while Rocky Mountain Power is a larger regional utility. Both can serve different parts of the same ZIP code, with municipal utilities often covering specific city areas.
verifications.split_details: Lehi City Power likely serves areas within the city limits of Lehi, while Rocky Mountain Power serves areas outside the municipal utility's coverage, possibly in more rural or newly developed areas.

verifications.reasoning: Enbridge Gas primarily operates in Canada and does not serve Utah. Dominion Energy is a well-known provider in Utah, including the Lehi area.

verifications.reasoning: Both names refer to the same entity, Greenville Utilities Commission, which provides gas services in the area. The difference in naming is likely due to variations in data sources or naming conventions.

Saint Robert MO is not a utility provider but rather a location name. The confusion likely arises from the spreadsheet listing the location instead of the utility provider.
verifications.split_details: The area is primarily served by Laclede Electric Coop, and there is no indication of a split territory with another provider.

Municipal utilities often operate under the city's name or a similar designation. The spreadsheet and API/GIS sources are likely using different naming conventions for the same entity.
